node.title: .NET Boxed Visual Studio Integration
node.description: You can now create .NET Boxed projects directly from Visual Studio. Here's a short post showing you how.

node.title: Exporting Open Telemetry Data to Jaeger
node.description: How to optimally export Open Telemetry metrics, logs, and traces for .NET to Jaeger.

node.title: Open Telemetry for ASP.NET Core
node.description: The basics of how to configure Open Telemetry metrics, logs, and traces for ASP.NET Core and export the traces.

node.title: Deep Dive into Open Telemetry for .NET
node.description: How to use the Open Telemetry specification, tools and SDK's used to instrument, generate, collect, and export telemetry data (metrics, logs, and traces) using .NET and ASP.NET.

node.title: Muhammad Rehan Saeed: Developer at Microsoft | Leonardo Tuna Podcast
node.description: I did a fun podcast episode with Leonardo Tuna. We talked about the difficulty of getting a job at Microsoft, some of my work there, JavaScript frontend frameworks, Vue vs React and my interesting experiences writing software for education at Bridge International Academies.

node.title: Automating .NET Security Updates
node.description: .NET SDK updates are released every few weeks. In this post, I talk about how you can automate them.

node.title: The Easiest Way to Version NuGet Packages
node.description: Using MinVer is the easiest way to version your NuGet packages and DLL's using semantic versioning (SemVer).

node.title: Unit Testing dotnet new Templates
node.description: It's difficult to know if your 'dotnet new' based project will work if they have lots of options, in this post I show how to unit test them.

node.title: The Dotnet Watch Tool Revisited
node.description: The dotnet watch tool is a file watcher for dotnet that restarts the application when changes in the source code are detected. You can use dotnet watch in Visual Studio by using the launchSettings.json configuration file.

node.title: ASP.NET Core Caching in Practice
node.description: How to use and implement Cache-Control, Cache-Control Immutable, E-Tag, Last-Modified and If-Modified-Since Caching HTTP headers in ASP.NET Core.

node.title: Structured Data using Schema.NET
node.description: Schema.NET is Schema.org objects turned into strongly typed C# POCO classes for use in .NET.

node.title: ASP.NET Core Lazy Command Pattern
node.description: Move your ASP.NET Core MVC action method logic into lazily loaded commands using the command pattern, to reduce Controller complexity.

node.title: dotnet new Feature Selection
node.description: How to add feature selection to your dotnet new template using symbols (bool, string, choice, computed) and pre-processor directives.

node.title: Cleaning Up CSPROJ
node.description: I show how to make the new Visual Studio 2017 .NET Core based csproj XML concise and pretty for hand editing.

node.title: Custom Project Templates Using dotnet new
node.description: How to create project templates using dotnet new and the template.json file. How to share project templates by creating NuGet packages.

node.title: Reactive Extensions (Rx) - Part 8 - Timeouts
node.description: Should you use Reactive Extensions (Rx) to do timeouts in .NET? It turns out it's better to use CancellationTokenSource in the Task Parallel Library (TPL).

node.title: SEO Friendly URL's for ASP.NET Core
node.description: An SEO friendly URL is human readable and gives your site a higher page rank. Learn how to implement SEO friendly URL's using ASP.NET Core.

node.title: Making Application Insights Fast & Secure
node.description: Implementing Application Insights into your ASP.NET Core application with performance and security as a top priority in this advanced scenario.

node.title: The Dotnet Watch Tool
node.description: The dotnet watch tool is a file watcher for dotnet that restarts the application when changes in the source code are detected.

node.title: Social TagHelpers for ASP.NET Core
node.description: Enhance the experience of sharing a page from your site through the use of social media meta tags implemented with ASP.NET Core TagHelpers.

node.title: Subresource Integrity TagHelper Using ASP.NET Core - Part 2
node.description: Use an ASP.NET Core TagHelper to implement Subresource Integrity (SRI) to ensure that external resources have not been tampered with. With is part 2.

node.title: Subresource Integrity TagHelper Using ASP.NET Core - Part 1
node.description: Use an ASP.NET Core TagHelper to implement Subresource Integrity (SRI) to ensure that external resources have not been tampered with.

node.title: Colorful.Console
node.description: Colorful.Console is a C# library that wraps around the System.Console class, making your console apps more colourful. Write ASCII art using Figlet fonts.

node.title: Logging with Serilog.Exceptions
node.description: Log exception details and custom properties that are not output in Exception.ToString() using Serilog.Exceptions for .NET.

node.title: Dynamically Generating Sitemap.xml for ASP.NET MVC
node.description: How to dynamically generate a sitemap.xml file using ASP.NET MVC to improve the Search Engine Optimization (SEO) of your site and get better search rankings.

node.title: Whats New in ASP.NET Core Boilerplate
node.description: With the release of ASP.NET Core Boilerplate, this post discusses what's new and what is currently missing due to ASP.NET Core still being in beta.

node.title: Dynamically Generating Robots.txt Using ASP.NET MVC
node.description: How to dynamically generate a robots.txt file using a simple ASP.NET MVC action method and only a few lines of code.

node.title: Canonical URL's for ASP.NET MVC
node.description: Use canonical URL's in ASP.NET MVC for better Search Engine Optimization (SEO) using ASP.NET Core Boilerplate and the RedirectToCanonicalUrlAttribute.

node.title: Building RSS/Atom Feeds for ASP.NET MVC
node.description: How to build a fully featured RSS/Atom feed for ASP.NET MVC, including Google's PubSubHubbub and the 'Subscribe to this feed' button.

node.title: C# 6.0 - Saving Developers From Themselves
node.description: C# 6.0 helps reduce human error and save developers from themselves using the nameof operator, string interpolation and the null-conditional operator.

node.title: Content Security Policy (CSP) for ASP.NET MVC
node.description: Content Security Policy (CSP) is a HTTP header which white-lists content the browser is allowed to load. This post discusses its application in ASP.NET MVC.

node.title: NWebSec ASP.NET MVC Security Through HTTP Headers
node.description: The NWebSec NuGet packages help secure your ASP.NET MVC site using HTTP headers. The ASP.NET Core Boilerplate project template configures them our of the box.

node.title: Reactive Extensions (Rx) - Part 7 - Sample Events
node.description: Shows how to use the Reactive Extensions (Rx) Sample method to reduce the number of subscribed events by taking a sample from them over a given time period.

node.title: Securing the ASP.NET MVC Web.config
node.description: The web.config file is insecure in the default ASP.NET MVC project template. This post talks you through securing the ASP.NET MVC Web.config file.

node.title: Custom Visual Studio Project Templates
node.description: A guide to creating custom Visual Studio project templates in .zip and VSIX form and submitting them to the Visual Studio Gallery, so it can be downloaded.

node.title: Internet Favicon Madness (Updated)
node.description: Add favicon's to your website to support iOS, Android, Windows 7, Windows 8, Windows Phone and more. Find out where icons are used on each platform and how.

node.description: ASP.NET Core Boilerplate is a professional ASP.NET MVC template for building secure, fast, robust and adaptable web applications or sites.
